column4: TransAlta Renewables to invest C$540 mln in TransAlta Corp projects
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Nov 23 Canadian renewable energy company TransAlta Renewables said on Monday it would invest C$540 million ($404 million) in three projects in Ontario and Quebec belonging to its majority-owner TransAlta Corp.

column4: Tyson Foods quarterly sales beat estimates; shares soar 10 percent
column5: Tyson Foods Inc   the biggest U.S. meat processor  reported better-than-expected quarterly sales on Monday  sending its shares up by over 10 percent as strong demand for chicken products and a boost from its purchase of sausage seller Hillshire Brands buoyed results.

column4: UPDATE 3-Tyson Foods quarterly sales beat estimates; shares soar 10 pct
column5: Nov 23 Tyson Foods Inc  the biggest U.S. meat processor  reported better-than-expected quarterly sales on Monday  sending its shares up by over 10 percent as strong demand for chicken products and a boost from its purchase of sausage seller Hillshire Brands buoyed results.

column4: Tyson Foods quarterly sales rise 4 pct
column5: Nov 23 Tyson Foods Inc  the biggest U.S. meat processor  reported a 4 percent rise in quarterly sales  helped by higher demand for chicken and as the Hillshire Brands acquisition boosted sales of prepared foods.

column4: Ackman boosts stake in drugmaker Valeant
column5: Activist investor Bill Ackman's hedge fund has significantly increased its investment in Valeant Pharmaceuticals International   and signaled it may play a greater role in the beleaguered drugmaker’s strategy  according to a regulatory filing.

column4: Ackman raises stake in Valeant Pharma
column5: Nov 23 Bill Ackman's Pershing Square Capital Management raised its stake in Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  to 9.9 percent  making it the second largest shareholder in the company.

column4: Hedge funds' favorite stocks lag broader market: Goldman data
column5: BOSTON Hedge fund managers' favorite stocks stumbled hard this year to post their worst returns since the financial crisis with health-care companies  such as Valeant Pharmaceuticals   leading the way lower  according to new data from Goldman Sachs.

column4: Wal-Mart pulls Cyber Monday forward to Sunday  record industry sales expected
column5: Nov 23 Wal-Mart Stores Inc has decided that Cyber Monday  the biggest online shopping day of the year  should not start on a Monday anymore.

column4: Wells Fargo likely to issue more debt to comply with new rules
column5: Nov 23 - Wells Fargo & Co will likely need to issue an additional $40 billion to $60 billion of long-term debt to comply with new rules designed to help banks better weather a crisis  Chief Financial Officer John Shrewsberry said on Friday.

column4: Icahn takes stake in Xerox  calls shares 'undervalued'
column5: Activist investor Carl Icahn disclosed a stake in Xerox Corp   and called the printer and copier maker's shares "undervalued"  sending its shares up 7.6 percent in extended trade.

column4: UPDATE 2-Icahn takes stake in Xerox  calls shares "undervalued"
column5: Nov 23 Activist investor Carl Icahn disclosed a stake in Xerox Corp  and called the printer and copier maker's shares "undervalued"  sending its shares up 7.6 percent in extended trade.

column4: CORRECTED-Icahn takes 7.13 pct stake in Xerox
column5: Nov 23 Activist investor Carl Icahn said he had taken a a 7.13 percent stake in Xerox Corp  best known for its printers and copiers.

column4: UPDATE 1-Yamana Gold to cut stake in Brio unit to 21 pct in private placement
column5: Nov 23 Canada-based Yamana Gold Inc and its wholly owned subsidiary Brio Gold Inc have started a private placement of Brio shares  Yamana said on Monday  a move that will reduce its stake in the unit to around 21 percent.

column4: Yamana Gold to cut stake in Brio unit to 21 pct in private placement
column5: Nov 23 Yamana Gold Inc said on Monday its wholly owned subsidiary Brio Gold Inc has started a private placement of Brio shares  which will reduce Yamana's stake in the unit to around 21 percent.

column4: Manitoba Telecom to sell unit to Zayo for C$465 mln
column5: Nov 23 Canadian telecom company Manitoba Telecom Services Inc said on Monday it had agreed to sell its unit  Allstream Inc  to U.S.-based Zayo Group Holdings Inc  for C$465 million ($347.4 million) in cash.

column4: Hedge funds' favorite stocks lag broader market -Goldman data
column5: BOSTON  Nov 23 Hedge fund managers' favorite stocks stumbled hard this year to post their worst returns since the financial crisis with health-care companies  such as Valeant Pharmaceuticals  leading the way lower  according to new data from Goldman Sachs.
